assessed.address: Centric, Gunnels Wood Road, Stevenage SG1 2AS

sites.address: Dallow Road, Laporte Retail Park, Luton LU1 1HL

sites.notes: ‚≠ê BEST LOCATION FOUND - Prime retail park in Luton. Near Aldi, B&Q, Lidl, DFS. 1.2mi from M1 J11. High visibility/footfall. BUT: Only Compound 3 available (unknown size), B8‚ÜíClass E change of use needed, must build courts from scratch.

sites.address: Mancroft Road, Slip End, Bedfordshire/Hertfordshire Border LU1
sites.planningStatus: INSET from Green Belt - normal planning policy applies
sites.notes: ‚≠ê EXCELLENT OPTION - 2.17 acres for ¬£145k is great value! 'Inset' Green Belt means normal planning applies. Next to residential retirement village development (158 homes). Perfect size for 4 courts + parking + reception. NO OVERAGE. Very close to Luton. Near M1 J10.
pros: Inset from Green Belt = easier planning
cons: Would need planning for leisure use

pros: Already has 5 tennis courts - easy padel conversion
cons: Listing appears removed - may be let

Within hotel grounds - may have restrictions

sites.planningStatus: Multiple use potential - woodland carbon code registration possible

sites.address: Clements End Road, Between Gaddesden Row & Studham HP2
sites.planningStatus: Agricultural - in Chiltern Hills AONB. Local barn conversion precedents.
sites.access: Two gated entrances, newly installed track
sites.notes: Large site with 9 agricultural buildings (62,588 sq ft total). Could potentially convert barns to indoor courts. BUT: ¬£2.5m price tag is very high, 25% overage clause for 33 years, and in AONB (stricter planning). Better suited to residential development given price.
cons: Price reflects residential development potential, not leisure
